_header: Three things there are that done me sigh sore

BLHar485.Transcription:
Thre thinges þar ern þat don[e] me sigh soreOne is þat
                    I [s]all fonden o WayAnothir is þat I no wote wen no w[ere]Ne wat
                    dede to die wite I ne mayOoe for þe latter dynt drede[þ] [m]e
                    moreAnd droupe[s] ful drerly for drede of þat day
BLHar485.Editions:
Heffernan,  Thomas J. 
             “Unpublished Middle English Verses on ‘The Three Sorrowful
                Things.’” 
             Neuphilologische Mitteilungen
         83 (1982): 31-3: 33.

HerefordO414.First Lines:
þre þynges me dryt [ ]þat ic nete nowth w[
                    ]…
HerefordO414.Last Lines: …þe þrydde is al my [ ]How myn sowle [ ]
HerefordO414.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.446.
